title.narrative: Camp Coordination and Camp Management (CCCM), Direct Life-Saving and Assistance for Durable Solution for Conflict-Affected Populations in Tanganyika Province, Democratic Republic of Congo

description.narrative: Displacement caseloads in the Democratic Republic of the Congo are mixed between the recent wave of population movements and populations displaced for over three years. As a result, the needs and the situations lived by these internally displaced persons, vary significantly in terms of their security, the length of displacement periods, and their wishes for longer-term solutions. Within this action, IOM intervenes to support the displaced populations towards durable solutions as well as to provide life-saving assistance to populations continue to be displaced in Tanganyika province. IOM is providing the displaced populations with access for information on options to return, relocation or local integration, facilitating the populations to know better their area of destination, providing transportation, multipurpose cash and shelter assistance to allow the returnees to start their new life outside the camp. For this action, IOM is collaborating bilaterally with UNICEF who is providing assistance in the destination area namely water, sanitation and hygiene assistance, education, assistance for malnutrition cases, vaccination.
